item.title: Gatsby and Sanity.io - Part 3 (Live Stream)
item.description:
Gatsby and Sanity.io are a great pair for creating JAMstack projects like blogs. In these videos, I am working to migrate my Gatsby blog from using markdown files to using the Headless CMS called Sanity.io. After starting this migration, I am loving Gatsby and Sanity.io

item.description: Power Query is a data connection technology that enables you to discover, connect, combine, and refine data sources to meet your analysis needs. item.title: It's like JSON. but fast and small.
item.description: MessagePack is an efficient binary serialization format. It lets you exchange data among multiple languages like JSON. But it's faster and smaller. Small integers are encoded into a single byte, and typical short strings require only one extra byte in addition to the strings themselves.
item.author: (Salvatore Sanfilippo, creator of Redis)

item.title: ASP.NET Blog | Blazor WebAssembly 3.2.0 Preview 4 release now available
item.description:
A new preview update of Blazor WebAssembly is now available! Here’s what’s new in this release:
Access host environment during startup Logging improvements Brotli precompression Load assemblies and runtime in parallel Simplify IL linker config for apps Localization support API docs in IntelliSense
Get started To get started with Blazor WebAssembly 3.2.0 Preview 4 install the latest .NET Core 3.1 SDK.
item.author: (Daniel RothPrincipal Program Manager, ASP.NETFollow)

item.title: When to Mock
item.description:
The use of mocks in unit testing is a controversial topic (maybe less so now than several years ago). I remember how, throughout my programming career, I went from mocking almost every dependency, to the "no-mocks" policy, and then to "only mock external dependencies".
None of this practices are good enough. In this article, I’ll show you which dependencies to mock, and which to use as is in your tests.
item.author: (Vladimir Khorikov)
